Title.Subtitle: Women Speak Out About Violence and Abuse

Contributor.BiographicalNote: <p>Linda Goyette is a writer, editor, and journalist with a strong interest in oral history and contemporary storytelling. She has written three books of non-fiction and is the author of three of the four Courageous Kids books: <i>Kidmonton: True Stories of River City Kids</i>, <i>Rocky Mountain Kids</i>, and <i>Northern Kids</i>. Visit her website at www.lindagoyette.ca.</p>

OtherText.Text:
<p><i>Standing Together</i> is a powerful expression of women's collective and individual strength. It is a collection of personal stories from women who have suffered the horrors of violence and abuse and have made the hardest decision: to stand up, choose life, take control and walk away from the darkness.</p>
<p>The disturbing, compelling, and inspiring stories in <i>Standing Together</i> were written by women of all ages, professions, and ethnicities, from rural and urban areas and all social backgrounds; they could be women you know. They tell of abuse at the hands of husbands, boyfriends and partners, fathers and strangers. They tell of deciding to seek help, leaving a life of fear for one of hope. They tell of the family, friends, and strangers that helped them rebuild their lives. Taken together, they form a greater story of hope and inspiration: <i>You are not alone. You can make a change. You can survive this, get through the pain, and build a new life. You have the strength; we have the strength when we stand together.</i></p>
